article:
{{Infobox family name

'Thompson' is a patronymic surname of English and Scottish origin, with a
variety of spellings meaning "son of Thom". An alternative
origin may be geographical, arising from the placename Thompson. It is the 14th-most common surname in the United
Kingdom. [http://www.britishsurnames.co.uk/surnames/THOMPSON British
surnames] According to the 1990 United States Census, Thompson was the
seventeenth most frequently reported surname, accounting for 0.27% of the
population. United States Census Bureau (9 May 1995). . Retrieved on 2008-07-
04. Notable people with the surname include:

*Ahmir Khalib Thompson (born 1971), aka Questlove, African-American musician,
DJ, and record producer *Alana "Honey Boo Boo" Thompson (born 2005), American
reality television personality *Alden Thompson, Christian theologian *Andrew
Thompson (catcher) (born 1846), baseball player *Andrew Thompson (manager)
(1845â1895), baseball manager *Archie Thompson, Australian football (soccer)
player for Melbourne Victory *Ben Thompson (lawman) (1842â1884), gunfighter and
gambler *Benjamin Thompson (1753â1814), Anglo-American physicist, usually
called "Count Rumford" *Bill Thompson (New York), 42nd New York City
